summary: The Department of Homeland Security's Chief Acquisition Officer designates Component Acquisition Executives to oversee each component's acquisition programs and policies, the acquisition workforce, and program data collection and reporting. But DHS can't be sure all of these executives are qualified or that they're consistently fulfilling all of their acquisition-related responsibilities. For example, of the 5 such executives in DHS's Management Directorate, 4 hadn't been vetted...
title: Homeland Security Acquisitions: DHS Has Opportunities to Improve Its Component Acquisition Oversight
